fchen

Class HashTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • fchen.HashTree

  • public class HashTree
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the hash authentication tree primitive. The hash tree is stored in an array and indexed according to the node position in the complete binary tree. The root node is stored at index 0;
    Author:
    Chen, Fei (https://sites.google.com/site/chenfeiorange/), First draft on 12-03-2013. License: GNU GPL, Email: chenfeiorange@163.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HashTree(int treeHeight, byte[][] leaf)
      This function constructs the hash authentication tree using the leaf nod provided.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HashTree

        public HashTree(int treeHeight,
        byte[][] leaf)
        This function constructs the hash authentication tree using the leaf nod provided.
        Parameters:
        treeHeight - - This parameter can also be calculated using the size of the leaf nodes.
        leaf - - The leaf nodes

    • Method Detail

      • verify

        public static boolean verify(byte[][] authenticationPath,
             byte[] root)
        This function checks whether an authentication path is correct.
        Parameters:
        authenticationPath - - An authentication path from the bottom to the root. The root value is at the end of the array.
        root - - The root value of an hash tree.
        Returns:
        - If it is correct, return true; else false.

      • build

        public void build()
        This function builds the whole hash tree from the bottom to the top. The root value is at index 0;

      • getRoot

        public byte[] getRoot()
        This function gets the root hash value of the hash tree.
        Returns:
        - The root hash value

      • getAuthenticationPath

        public byte[][] getAuthenticationPath(int index)
        This function gets the authentication path for the node with index 'index'.
        Parameters:
        index - - The index of the leaf node which is to be authenticated. It starts with 0.
        Returns:
        - An authentication path from the bottom to the top, with corresponding index becoming large

      • print

        public void print()
        This funtion prints out the whole hash tree.
